column28: This C5th monastery is on a hill to the south of Urfa now almost reached by suburbs. It is difficult to reach and marked on few maps – I have been unable to locate it in gazetteers. John Healey alerted me to its existence ahead of field work in Urfa.

column28: Both the Monastery of St. James the Persian/St. James Intercisus on the edge of the town and the parish church of Sts. Sergius and Bacchus have remnants of medieval fresco cycles even though some scenes are now in the National Museum in Damascus and the nearby Museum of Deir Atiyeh.

column28: The Church of Mar Elian is believed to date back to the C5th and, although largely rebuilt after a catastrophic fire, elements of a medieval fresco cycle remain in the small side apse around the late antique sarcophagus of the saint.
